review: I love the ability to  walk right in my living room and start netflix, you tube and amazon.  I don't have to worry about looking for my remote for my smart TV.
author: JTaylor

review: Straightforward to set up and work with my iPhone - but with caveats :1. Cannot use it with my network extender2. Cannot use with my iMac with VPN installed. This MAY be due to a custom Mac OS install by my workplace IT organizationOne final comment - Google tech support were excellent !
author: Diane Bailey

review: We recently "pulled the plug" and switched to mostly streaming.  We got 3 different media players: Roku 3, WD, and Google Chromecast.  We were a bit disappointed in the Google ... we admit we aren't techies and actually may be part of the problem. We like the compact size, smallest of the 3 by far, but you can only access it on your TV through your iphone or ipad or computer, which we find clunky. So far, we have only succeeded in connecting to Netflix, even though we know there are other options out there. We just can't find them.
author: Diane Guiseclowes "Book Frog"

review: Item doesn't work well and is inconsistent.  Too much trouble setting it up w/ router and no support!  You get what you pay for and $35 doesn't get you much
author: Mark Conmy

review: I know for certain if I had better internet connection I would be able to leverage this product to a far better extent. My wife loves it since we dont need to drag a HDMI capble out in order to stream netflix from our computer, so that alone makes it well worth it.

review: I am really impressed with this little device. It plugs into the HDMI port on your TV, and then you're able to stream from an ever-growing list of apps and programs. Netflix streaming works like a dream from my computer, Android phone, and Android tablet.
